messages: 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (13:37): no blog post today?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:39): the whatwg blog? feel free to write one
0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17 (13:40): nono, I've blogged once today already
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:42): still has no idea what to do in the next twenty minutes
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (13:48): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Write an excellent whatwg blog post
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:48): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: My mind is void of ideas, though
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (13:50): 0da07476c4bd14079ce4032a6f280e17: I wasn't aware that youtube hosted opera's press releases. I thought we were against using proprietary video ;)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:51): Double-standards! Opera are worthless!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:51): Scub!
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (13:53): Are you pro or anti?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:53): I'm not a pro, I'm just an amateur
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (13:54): You could write a post saying HTML5 is now defining scub a MUST NOT requirement
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:54): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9: not overly funny, though
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (13:55): Of course not, that's just a seed idea. You have to plant and nourish it so it'll bloom into excellence :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (13:55): what is "scub"?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:55): scum spelt wrong
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:56): scub is‚Ä¶ http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=Scub
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:56): I wobn't say here
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:56): Well, there's more than one meaning
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:57): But I meant scum, I just spelt it wrong :P
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (13:57): There's also http://pbfcomics.com/?cid=PBF020-Skub.gif
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:05): HTML 5 is so pointless. We should just be moving to XHTML 5.
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:07): You aren't even trying :/
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:08): I mean, with XML 5!
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:09): How about getting Hixie to resign as editor. That might work :)

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:09): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, april fools day articles need to be about something funny that is unlikely to ever happen. XML 5 is very likely to happen one day
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:10): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I know :P
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:10): a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9, IIRC, Hixie said no to that one last year

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:11): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: last year on my blog: me getting a gf. Anyone who knows me well enough on IM, or how I acted in some IRC channels then, would find that totally implausible
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:11): though, I could be wrong. But I'm fairly sure it was thought of and there was some reason not to go for it
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (14:11): We could try Hyatt, but who even knows he's also an editor
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:11): I do!!1111!!1eleventy!
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:12): anyone know if the IETF will actually be publishing an RFC today?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:13): They didn't in 2007, did they?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:13): I dunno. I've not been in contact with the RFC editor for a while
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:13): yeah, last year was the semaphore flag signalling thing
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:13): http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc4824
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:13): ah. I forgot that one.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:13): Bert was the year before, then?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:14): Yeah, he was
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:14): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/April_Fools%27_Day_RFC
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:23): wonders whether to try to implement UTF-9 in an 8-bit language
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:33): so who's gonna write something on the whatwg blog?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:37): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0, I will if someone comes up with a good topic
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:38): everything I think of is just not funny enough
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (14:39): there was some discussion yesterday
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:41): aargh! blog.whatwg.org has internal server errors
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (14:41): hmm. weird, it fixed after a reload
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:58): really can't think of anything funny
3e7a854e7a0a1af7eba2005b0bdd4a1a (15:01): http://my.opera.com/desktopteam/blog/2008/04/01/acid-3-opera-first-to-106
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:03): blames Hixie
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:03): I'm not convinced, really. Six points for changing each block into an egg, but there should be a seventh point for making one of the eggs hatch!
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:06): anyone know anyway to do URL normalisation in Python?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:13): we should just introduce a bug that causes Acid3 to enter an infinite loop, and then we can claim to the first browser to reach infinity
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (15:14): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: But an infinite loop will only ever have reached a finite number of repetitions...
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:15): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c, not if we leave the build running for eternity
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:15): Hixie: can the test be changed to the easter egg version? :P
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (15:16): cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0: Sure, if you reveal the triggers :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:16): maybe we could publish a UserJS that does it, like Opera did for Acid2 with the eyes
cc097e0d7183ae8436e7df709553c8c0 (15:17): acid2 with the eyes?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:18): there was a build of Opera (and subsequent UserJS) released that caused the eyes to begin following the mouse after about a minute
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (15:19): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Features_of_the_Opera_web_browser#Opera_9_Acid2_easter_egg
